verses.kjv: When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died.
verses.web: When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling. He exalted himself in Israel, but when he became guilty in Baal, he died.
verses.ct: There was a time when Ephraim spoke and people trembled. He was honored and powerful in Israel. But then he worshiped Baal, and that sin destroyed him.

verses.kjv: And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
verses.web: Now they sin more and more, and have made themselves molten images of their silver, even idols according to their own understanding, all of them the work of the craftsmen. They say of them, ‘They offer human sacrifice and kiss the calves.’
verses.ct: Now they keep sinning more and more. They melt down their silver to make cast idols — statues designed by human imagination, all of them nothing but the work of craftsmen. Yet they say, "Let those who sacrifice kiss the calf idols!"

verses.kjv: Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud, and as the early dew that passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the floor, and as the smoke out of the chimney.
verses.web: Therefore they will be like the morning mist, and like the dew that passes away early, like the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the threshing floor, and like the smoke out of the chimney.
verses.ct: Because of this, they will vanish like morning mist, like dew that disappears at dawn, like chaff swept off the threshing floor by a whirlwind, like smoke drifting out of a chimney.

verses.kjv: Yet I am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt, and thou shalt know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.
verses.web: “Yet I am LORD your God from the land of Egypt; and you shall acknowledge no god but me, and besides me there is no savior.
verses.ct: "I am the LORD your God, the one who brought you out of Egypt. You must acknowledge no god but me, because there is no savior besides me.

verses.kjv: I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
verses.web: I knew you in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
verses.ct: I cared for you in the wilderness, in that scorching, barren land.

verses.kjv: According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me.
verses.web: According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted. Therefore they have forgotten me.
verses.ct: But when I fed them and they were full, they became proud — and then they forgot me.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:
verses.web: Therefore I am like a lion to them. Like a leopard, I will lurk by the path.
verses.ct: So now I will be like a lion to them. Like a leopard, I will crouch beside the road and wait.

verses.kjv: I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps, and will rend the caul of their heart, and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast shall tear them.
verses.web: I will meet them like a bear that is bereaved of her cubs, and will tear the covering of their heart. There I will devour them like a lioness. The wild animal will tear them.
verses.ct: I will attack them like a mother bear whose cubs have been taken away. I will rip open their chests and devour them like a lioness. Wild animals will tear them apart.

verses.kjv: O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself; but in me is thine help.
verses.web: You are destroyed, Israel, because you are against me, against your help.
verses.ct: Israel, you have destroyed yourself! I was your help, but you turned against me.

verses.kjv: I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?
verses.web: Where is your king now, that he may save you in all your cities? And your judges, of whom you said, ‘Give me a king and princes?’
verses.ct: Where is your king now? Let him save you in all your cities! Where are those rulers you demanded when you said, 'Give me a king and princes'?

verses.kjv: I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath.
verses.web: I have given you a king in my anger, and have taken him away in my wrath.
verses.ct: I gave you a king in my anger, and I took him away in my wrath.

verses.kjv: The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is hid.
verses.web: The guilt of Ephraim is stored up. His sin is stored up.
verses.ct: Ephraim's guilt has been bundled up and stored away. His sin is on record.

verses.kjv: The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in the place of the breaking forth of children.
verses.web: The sorrows of a travailing woman will come on him. He is an unwise son; for when it is time, he doesn’t come to the opening of the womb.
verses.ct: The pain of a woman in labor will come upon him. He is a foolish child — when the moment of birth arrives, he refuses to come out of the womb.

verses.kjv: I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be thy plagues; O grave, I will be thy destruction: repentance shall be hid from mine eyes.
verses.web: I will ransom them from the power of Sheol. I will redeem them from death! Death, where are your plagues? Sheol, where is your destruction? “Compassion will be hidden from my eyes.
verses.ct: Will I ransom them from the power of the grave? Will I redeem them from death? Death, where are your plagues? Grave, where is your destruction? I will not take back my judgment — compassion is hidden from my eyes.

verses.kjv: Though he be fruitful among his brethren, an east wind shall come, the wind of the LORD shall come up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up: he shall spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.
verses.web: Though he is fruitful among his brothers, an east wind will come, the breath of LORD coming up from the wilderness; and his spring will become dry, and his fountain will be dried up. He will plunder the storehouse of treasure.
verses.ct: Even though Ephraim thrives among his brothers, an east wind is coming — the wind of the LORD, blowing up from the wilderness. It will dry up his springs and drain his wells. It will plunder his storehouses and strip away every treasure.

verses.kjv: Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.
verses.web: Samaria will bear her guilt; for she has rebelled against her God. They will fall by the sword. Their infants will be dashed in pieces, and their pregnant women will be ripped open.”
verses.ct: Samaria must bear her guilt, because she has rebelled against her God. Her people will fall by the sword. Their infants will be dashed to pieces, and their pregnant women will be ripped open.
